question: Question_07_(a)
statement:
Cholera is a disease that can spread through untreated sewage polluting
the drinking water supply. Let $\displaystyle y(t)$ be the fraction of
people in a population who have the disease at time \emph{t}. Assume
that in a certain city, the fraction of people who have the disease
increases at a rate proportional to the fraction of people who do not
yet have the disease. (We will use $\displaystyle k > 0$ as the constant
of proportionality).

(a) Write down the differential equation that y(t) satisfies.
